body_html:
@aiff22
Thank you for the report.

Which model are you benchmarking on these devices.

Are you using the Java API?

  • TF Lite being 1.5- 2 times slower seems unlikely, I want to make sure if you are setting the number of threads correctly. We recently added this to our Java API, please give it a try.
  • Java API is slower if you are not using ByteBuffer, there is a warning in the Javadoc about this:
    https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/lite/java/src/main/java/org/tensorflow/lite/Interpreter.java#L134
    Make sure you are using the right format for inputs.

If you are using C++, can you use our newly added benchmarking binary and see if the numbers are same:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/contrib/lite/tools/benchmark
and report detailed numbers on which ops seem slower.

Tensorflow mobile has a similar binary in:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/tools/benchmark

body:
@aiff22 
Thank you for the report.

Which model are you benchmarking on these devices.

Are you using the Java API?
 - TF Lite being 1.5- 2 times slower seems unlikely, I want to make sure if you are setting the number of threads correctly. We recently added this to our Java API, please give it a try.
- Java API is slower if you are not using ByteBuffer, there is a warning in the Javadoc about this:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/lite/java/src/main/java/org/tensorflow/lite/Interpreter.java#L134
Make sure you are using the right format for inputs.

If you are using C++, can you use our newly added benchmarking binary and see if the numbers are same:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/contrib/lite/tools/benchmark
and report detailed numbers on which ops seem slower.

Tensorflow mobile has a similar binary in:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/tools/benchmark
